critique: The document expresses a sense of urgency and determination to maintain air mail service despite the cancellation of contracts. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are a sense of reassurance (joy) that the government is taking action to address the emergency, and a reduction of fear and surprise that the air mail service will be disrupted. There might be a slight element of sadness due to the annulled contracts, but the focus is on resolving the issue. Disgust and anger are less relevant in this context, as the document aims to project a sense of control and resolution rather than dwelling on negative emotions.
